hanzi-su-wiki:
窮

Значения

Доводить до конца; доходить до предела

Мнемоника

Бедняк в тяжёлом положении. Тело 身 согнуто, как лук 弓, в пещере 穴. Нищета, крайность.

Варианты

穷, 竆
purpleculture_pinyin:
qióng
poor; destitute; to use up; to exhaust; thoroughly; extremely; (coll.) persistently and pointlessly
бедные; нищий; Использовать; исчерпать; тщательно; очень сильно; (колл.) настойчиво и бессмысленно
rtega_mnemonic:
窮窮RS
穷穷		poor, destitute, impoverished

  • Man took a shot from a bow 弓 in his body 身 and was dropped in a hole 穴: cornered situation

heisig_chinese_memo:
Some poor people live in a hole in the wall apartment so they like to spend time outside on the stoop.  

So poor you have nothing but your body, living in a hole, and just a bow to hunt for your food.
heisig_constituent: hard up, hole, house, human legs, somebody, nose, bow
Keyword_KANJIDIC: hard up, destitute, suffer, perplexed, cornered
koohiiStory1: Hard up = nothing but your body, living in a hole, with just a bow to hunt for your food.
koohiiStory2: Somebody so hard up for cash, the volunteered to explore a black hole with nothing but a bow.
kunYomi: きわ.める、きわ.まる、きわ.まり、きわ.み
jp_example_words:
窮屈(きゅうくつ): narrow, tight, stiff, rigid, uneasy, formal, constrained
窮乏(きゅうぼう): poverty
jp_readingExamples: 窮まる (きわ.まる), 窮める (きわ.める)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Put a hole in someone's body with a bow and they'll become destitute. You put a hole in them. They can't work. They can't take care of their house or their kids. They've lost it all.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a destitute person wandering in the streets with a hole in their body.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You see this destitute person and decide to give them a cucumber (きゅう). They don't even remember that they're supposed to eat those, so they shove it in the hole you made with your bow.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture a destitute person, sitting on the street, holding a cucumber. Putting the cucumber in their hole. Crying.
Ru_Meaning: hard up, destitute, suffer, perplexed, cornered

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A lot of poor men with holes in their pants will work out a lot to get big muscles so the girls still like them.
humanum_full_description_en:
This work is "竆", from the " acupoint ", "躳" sound. Because "躳" is also called " bow ", it is written " poor ". Unearthed documents "Guodian Jian. The glyphs of "Tang Yu Zhi Dao" Jian 2 from "宀" to "躳", "宀" and " acupoint " are often used in ancient Chinese characters. Bamboo from there " hole " (or from " the Rock ") from the " body " of the glyph, also read as " poor ", generally considered to be " Qiong province form" of. (Refer to He Linyi) Such as "Guodian Jane. "Lao Zi Yi Ben" Jian 14 "Qi Yong (Use) is not [宀身] (Poor)".

The original meaning of " poor " is extreme, exhaustion, and end. "Shuowen": "Long, extremely. From the acupoints, the sound." Such as "Shangshu. "The Life of the Weizi": "Being as a guest in the royal family, resting with the country, and forever infinite." "Confucius": "The guest of the king and the time are beautiful, and there is no end in the eternal life." It means endless and infinite. Another example is "Historical Records. "The Book of the First Emperor of Qin": "The next generations are counted, and the second and third generations will be passed on infinitely."

" Poor " is extended as a verb, which means to reach the limit and seek the root cause. Such as "Zhou Yi. Say Gua": "Exhaustiveness and exhaustion to life." "Sun Tzu. "Positiveness": "Odd and positive, like the endless cycle of endless, who can be poor?"

" Poor " means obstruction is unreasonable, such as "Zhou Yi. "Xi Ci": "One opening and one opening is a change, and communication is endless." "Zhuangzi. "Lie Yu Kou": "The husband is in the poor Lu'e Alley, and the embarrassed weaving gimmicks, and those who have a yellow scorpion, the business is short." "Qing Lu'e Alley" is a narrow and closed alley. Another example is the idioms "the sun is at the end of the road" and "the road is at the end".

" Poor " also means distress and embarrassment. Such as "The Analects. "Wei Ling Gong": "A gentleman is too poor?" In particular, it refers to unwillingness. In ancient books, it is often opposed to " da ". Such as "Mencius. "To the best of my heart": "If you are poor, you will be good for yourself, and if you are good you will be good at the world." "Zhuangzi. "De Chong Fu": "Dying to survive and die, poor to rich and poor, good and unworthy to ruin reputation, hunger and thirst, cold and heat, is the change of things, the destiny." "Qing Da Yi Shi" is also opposed to " poor " and " da ".

" Poor " means poor and poor. "Guang Ya. Interpretation IV: "Poor, poor." Such as "Guan Zi. "Kidu": "If the fields are full, the people's wealth will be sufficient, and if the people's wealth is sufficient, the monarch's riches will never be poor." "Xunzi. "General": "Benevolence, justice, courtesy and goodness are good to others, and what is good is like goods and money, and corn is good for home. The more rich are rich, the rare poor, and the poor poor." See " Poor ".

" Poor " means to stop and stop. Such as "Book of Rites. "Confucianism": "Confucianism is erudite but not poor, and dedication and tirelessness." Zheng Xuan's note: "Indeed, not only." "Book of Shang Jun. "Calculating the Land": "Therefore, the rule of the saint is too much forbidden to stop the ability, and the strength is used to deceive."

" Poor " as an adverb means the most extreme. Such as "Mozi. "Tian Zhi 1": "He who is the son of heaven, the world is poor and noble, and the world is rich and poor." "Han. "Wang Mang's Passage": "Nai Shi was stunned, fought for his prestige and deceit, violently abused the people, and extremely vicious.

" Poor " means wronged and speechless. "Mencius. "Gongsun Chou Shang": "Escape to know what is poor." "Escape" refers to avoiding topics and flickering words. "Warring. "Qin Ce II": "How healthy is the envoy of the Chu guest, who fights with the widows, how can the widows be poor, what can they do?" Bao Biao's note: "Poor, resignation."

" Poor " also means remoteness and remoteness. Such as "Selected Works. Wang Kangju's "Poems against Zhao Yin": "Leave the gods out of the blue clouds, extinct in the poor mountains." Northern Song Dynasty Su Shi "Zhao Qingxiangong Shinto Stele": "Poor towns, people or livelihoods do not know the messenger." Another example is "poor countryside and remote areas." .

" Poor " means " bow ", meaning the body. Such as "Xunzi. "Rectification of Names": "If you say what you do, the world will be upright, if you say no, then you will be poor." Yu Yueping said: "Poor, should be pronounced as bow. Those who bow in white and bow, understand the way and hide their body. Ancient poverty and bow General. "The Analects of Confucius: Xiangdang Chapter" "Bow Ruye", "The Betrothal Ceremony" Zheng noted as "Juqiong", is the proof."
humanum_short_description_en: This work is "竆", from the " acupoint ", the sound of "躳". Because "躳" is also called " bow ", it is written " poor ". The original meaning is extreme, complete, and complete.
humanum_full_description:
本作「竆」，從「穴」，「躳」聲。因為「躳」又作「躬」，故寫作「窮」。出土文獻《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡2的字形從「宀」從「躳」，「宀」和「穴」兩個偏旁在古文字中常常通用。竹簡中還有從「穴」（或從「宀」）從「身」的字形，亦讀為「窮」，一般認為是「竆」的省形。（參何琳儀）如《郭店簡．老子乙本》簡14「其甬（用）不[宀身]（窮）」。

　　「窮」的本義是極、盡、完結。《說文》：「竆，極也。从穴，躳聲。」如《尚書．微子之命》：「作賓于王家，與國咸休，永世無窮。」《孔傳》：「為時王賓客與時皆美，長世無竟。」「無窮」和「無竟」皆表示無盡、無限。又如《史記．秦始皇本紀》：「後世以計數，二世三世至于萬世，傳之無窮。」

　　「窮」引申作動詞，表示到達極盡、尋根究源。如《周易．說卦》：「窮理盡性以至於命。」《孫子．勢》：「奇正相生，如循環之無端，孰能窮之？」

　　「窮」表示阻塞不通，如《周易．繫辭上》：「一闔一闢謂之變，往來不窮謂之通。」《莊子．列御寇》：「夫處窮閭阨巷，困窘織屨，槁項黃馘者，商之所短也。」「窮閭阨巷」即閉塞不通的狹小胡同。又如成語「日暮途窮」、「窮途末路」。

　　「窮」亦表示困厄、窘迫。如《論語．衛靈公》：「君子亦有窮乎？」特指不得志，古書中常與「達」相對。如《孟子．盡心上》：「窮則獨善其身，達則兼善天下。」《莊子．德充符》：「死生存亡，窮達貧富，賢與不肖毀譽，飢渴寒暑，是事之變，命之行也。」《郭店簡．窮達以時》亦以「窮」、「達」相對。

　　「窮」表示貧苦、窮困。《廣雅．釋詁四》：「窮，貧也。」如《管子．揆度》：「田野充則民財足，民財足則君賦歛焉不窮。」《荀子．大略》：「仁義禮善之於人也，辟之若貨財、粟米之於家也，多有之者富，少有之者貧，至無有者窮。」參見「貧」。

　　「窮」表示止息、杜絕。如《禮記．儒行》：「儒有博學而不窮，篤行而不倦。」鄭玄注：「不窮，不止也。」《商君書．算地》：「故聖人之治也，多禁以止能，任力以窮詐。」

　　「窮」作副詞表示最、極端的。如《墨子．天志上》：「故天子者，天下之窮貴也，天下之窮富也。」《漢書．王莽傳下》：「乃始恣睢，奮其威詐，滔天虐民，窮凶極惡。」

　　「窮」表示理屈、無言以對。《孟子．公孫丑上》：「遁辭知其所窮。」「遁辭」即迴避話題、閃爍其辭。《戰國策．秦策二》：「楚客來使者多健，與寡人爭辭，寡人數窮焉，為之奈何？」鮑彪注：「窮，辭屈也。」

　　「窮」還表示荒僻、偏遠。如《文選．王康琚〈反招隱詩〉》：「放神青雲外，絕迹窮山裏。」北宋蘇軾〈趙清獻公神道碑〉：「窮城小邑，民或生而不識使者。」又如「窮鄉僻壤」。

　　「窮」通「躬」，表示身體。如《荀子．正名》：「說行則天下正，說不行則白道而冥窮。」俞樾平議：「窮，當讀為躬。白道而冥躬者，明白其道而幽隱其身也。古窮與躬通用。《論語．鄉黨篇》『鞠躬如也』，〈聘禮〉鄭注作『鞠窮』，是其證。」
humanum_short_description: 本作「竆」，從「穴」，「躳」聲。因為「躳」又作「躬」，故寫作「窮」。本義是極、盡、完結。

Pinyin: qióng
English Definition: poor; destitute; to use up; to exhaust; thoroughly; extremely; (coll.) persistently and pointlessly
Antonyms: 富

Pictophonetic: 躬 indicates the sound; 穴 (cave) conveys the meaning.

窮困 [ qióng kùn ]: destitute; wretched poverty

①缺乏財物：貧窮。窮苦。窮則思變。
②處境惡劣：窮困。窮蹙。窮窘。窮當益堅(處境越窮困，意志應當越堅定)。窮而後工(舊時指文人處境窮困，詩就寫得好)。
③達到極點：窮目。窮形盡相。窮兵黷武。
④完了：窮盡。山窮水盡。日暮途窮。
⑤推究到極點：窮物之理。窮追(ａ．極力追尋；b．盡力緊追)。窮究。
⑥貧富。

本作「 竆 」，從「 穴 」，「 躳 」聲。因為「 躳 」又作「 躬 」，故寫作「 窮 」。出土文獻《郭店簡．唐虞之道》簡2的字形從「 宀 」從「 躳 」，「 宀 」和「 穴 」兩個偏旁在古文字中常常通用。竹簡中還有從「 穴 」（或從「 宀 」）從「 身 」的字形，亦讀為「 窮 」，一般認為是「 竆 」的省形。（參何琳儀）如《郭店簡．老子乙本》簡14「其甬（用）不[宀身]（窮）」。 「 窮 」的本義是極、盡、完結。《說文》：「竆，極也。从穴，躳聲。」如《尚書．微子之命》：「作賓于王家，與國咸休，永世無窮。」《孔傳》：「為時王賓客與時皆美，長世無竟。」「無窮」和「無竟」皆表示無盡、無限。又如《史記．秦始皇本紀》：「後世以計數，二世三世至于萬世，傳之無窮。」 「 窮 」引申作動詞，表示到達極盡、尋根究源。如《周易．說卦》：「窮理盡性以至於命。」《孫子．勢》：「奇正相生，如循環之無端，孰能窮之？」 「 窮 」表示阻塞不通，如《周易．繫辭上》：「一闔一闢謂之變，往來不窮謂之通。」《莊子．列御寇》：「夫處窮閭阨巷，困窘織屨，槁項黃馘者，商之所短也。」「窮閭阨巷」即閉塞不通的狹小胡同。又如成語「日暮途窮」、「窮途末路」。 「 窮 」亦表示困厄、窘迫。如《論語．衛靈公》：「君子亦有窮乎？」特指不得志，古書中常與「 達 」相對。如《孟子．盡心上》：「窮則獨善其身，達則兼善天下。」《莊子．德充符》：「死生存亡，窮達貧富，賢與不肖毀譽，飢渴寒暑，是事之變，命之行也。」《郭店簡．窮達以時》亦以「 窮 」、「 達 」相對。 「 窮 」表示貧苦、窮困。《廣雅．釋詁四》：「窮，貧也。」如《管子．揆度》：「田野充則民財足，民財足則君賦歛焉不窮。」《荀子．大略》：「仁義禮善之於人也，辟之若貨財、粟米之於家也，多有之者富，少有之者貧，至無有者窮。」參見「 貧 」。 「 窮 」表示止息、杜絕。如《禮記．儒行》：「儒有博學而不窮，篤行而不倦。」鄭玄注：「不窮，不止也。」《商君書．算地》：「故聖人之治也，多禁以止能，任力以窮詐。」 「 窮 」作副詞表示最、極端的。如《墨子．天志上》：「故天子者，天下之窮貴也，天下之窮富也。」《漢書．王莽傳下》：「乃始恣睢，奮其威詐，滔天虐民，窮凶極惡。」 「 窮 」表示理屈、無言以對。《孟子．公孫丑上》：「遁辭知其所窮。」「遁辭」即迴避話題、閃爍其辭。《戰國策．秦策二》：「楚客來使者多健，與寡人爭辭，寡人數窮焉，為之奈何？」鮑彪注：「窮，辭屈也。」 「 窮 」還表示荒僻、偏遠。如《文選．王康琚〈反招隱詩〉》：「放神青雲外，絕迹窮山裏。」北宋蘇軾〈趙清獻公神道碑〉：「窮城小邑，民或生而不識使者。」又如「窮鄉僻壤」。 「 窮 」通「 躬 」，表示身體。如《荀子．正名》：「說行則天下正，說不行則白道而冥窮。」俞樾平議：「窮，當讀為躬。白道而冥躬者，明白其道而幽隱其身也。古窮與躬通用。《論語．鄉黨篇》『鞠躬如也』，〈聘禮〉鄭注作『鞠窮』，是其證。」

窮字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qióng］
［《廣韻》渠弓切，平東，羣。］
亦作“竆1”。“穷1”的繁体字。
(1)尽，完。
(2)终端；终极。
(3)理屈；辞屈。
(4)空。
(5)贫苦。
(6)困窘；窘急。
(7)特指不得志。与“达”相对。
(8)指鳏、寡、孤、独四种无依靠的人。
(9)不肖的人；恶人。
(10)彻底推求；深入钻研。
(11)查究。
(12)揭穿；识破。
(13)止息；杜绝。
(14)不足；缺陷。
(15)荒僻；边远。参见“窮邊”、“窮域”。
(16)小；浅。参见“窮徑”、“窮流”。
(17)大。参见“窮怒”、“窮”。
(18)高。参见“窮陸”、“窮墉”。
(19)破旧；破烂。
(20)副词。最，非常。
(21)通“穹”。参见“窮廬”。
(22)古国名。
[②]［gōng］
［《集韻》居雄切，平東，見。］
通“躬1”。“穷2”的繁体字。
身体。

窮字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【穴字部】　窮； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页867第10
【韻會小補】說文本作竆。从穴躳聲。隷作窮。　又【集韻】居雄切，音弓。恭貌。本作匔。或从穴作窮。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qióng］
["Guangyun" Qu Gongqie, Pingdong, Qun. ]
Also known as "竆1". The traditional characters of "Poor 1".
(1) End, end.
(2) Terminal; ultimate.
(3) Reasons and speeches.
(4) Empty.
(5) Poverty.
(6) Embarrassment; embarrassment.
(7) Specifically refers to unwilling. Contrast with "Da".
(8) Refers to the four types of people who are widowed, widowed, lonely, and alone.
(9) Unscrupulous people; wicked people.
(10) Thoroughly seek; in-depth study.
(11) Investigate.
(12) Expose; see through.
(13) Stop; put an end to it.
(14) Insufficiency; defect.
(15) Lonely; remote. See "poor side", "poor domain".
(16) Small; shallow. See "poor path", "poor flow".
(17) Big. See "poor anger", "poor ".
(18) High. See "poor land" and "poor land".
(19) Dilapidated; tattered.
(20) Adverbs. Most, very much.
(21) Through the "dome". See "poor house".
(22) Ancient country names.
[②]［gōng］
["Jiyun" Juxiongqie, Pingdong, see you. ]
Same as "Bow 1". "Poor 2" in traditional characters.
body.

Name meaning

qióng
вм. 穷
Radicals: 穴, 身, 弓  (hole, body, bow)
Meaning Mnemonic
Put a hole in someone's body with a bow and they'll become destitute. You put a hole in them. They can't work. They can't take care of their house or their kids. They've lost it all.
Picture a destitute person wandering in the streets with a hole in their body.
Reading Mnemonic
You see this destitute person and decide to give them a cucumber (きゅう). They don't even remember that they're supposed to eat those, so they shove it in the hole you made with your bow.
Picture a destitute person, sitting on the street, holding a cucumber. Putting the cucumber in their hole. Crying.
